Title: Getting Around New York

Objectives:

* Learners will be able to understand and use vocabulary related to transportation in New York.
* Learners will be able to describe how to get around New York using different modes of transportation.
* Learners will be able to communicate their needs and preferences in a scenario-based context.

Materials:

* Picture cards of different modes of transportation (subway, bus, taxi, bike, etc.)
* Maps of New York City
* A scenario-based worksheet

Procedure:

1. Pre-teach: Start by pre-teaching vocabulary related to transportation, such as "subway," "bus," "taxi," and "bike." Use flashcards and have learners repeat the words and phrases.
2. Presenting information: Show learners pictures of the different modes of transportation and explain how to use them. Use gestures and simple sentences to help learners understand. For example, you could say "Take the subway to get to Times Square."
3. Practice: Have learners work in pairs to complete a scenario-based worksheet.
